title: Multi-Disciplinary Project - Android App
description:
The Multi-Disciplinary Project requires students to take up different roles, and work together to achieve two tasks: 
The first task is to traverse a maze and collect visual information in the fastest time.
The second task is to follow a specified path based on information received through visual information, and successfully park the robot back at its original location.
 
I was tasked with coming up with an android app that has the following requirements:
1. Robust Bluetooth Connection with Raspberry Pi.
2. Receive and display information provided by robots sensors and display dynamically on the screen.
3. UI to setup map configuration and to send this information to the robot prior to the maze run for processing.
 
Unlike most students who mainly copied from senior code, I intentionally wrote this solution from scratch in order to gain a better understanding of android development.
 
App Design Features:
 
Consistent Game State: Utilized MutableLiveData for maintaining consistent game state across various fragments.
Well-Organized Codebase: The application features well-defined classes and helper classes, ensuring ease of understanding and extensibility.
MVVM Architecture: Implemented the Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) pattern for clear separation of concerns. The Model handles data and game logic, the ViewModel acts as a bridge between the Model and the View, exposing relevant data, and the View is free of logic, focusing solely on the user interface.
 
 Video Editing: I was also one of the main editors for the video submission. I used Canva to edit the video.
